ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Readings on slavery and the civil war. Seminar discussion on readings oriented around issues in 19th century historiography. Yes, I would recommend the course to another student. Amazing professor and informative seminar readings and dialogue.

This course deals with writings of and concerning the 19th century. There is a strong emphasis on slavery and emancipation as being the most controversial and politically charged feature of this time period.
I would recommend this course to any graduate student with an interest in American history, irrespective of their decided era.
Yes, I'd recommend it to any student working on 19th century US history.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Dr. Blight is a good academic mentor and his knowledge of the subject matter allowed him to assist me in my own particular interests.
This course afforded me a wonderful reading list that I will continue to refer to as I prepare for my orals.
Coming from a different discipline, this course gave me the confidence to talk about social and political US history -- to tackle the big issues such as slavery instead of avoiding them.
